intro: Anthospermum holtzii, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its fruit is a schizocarp, splitting into two one-seeded parts when mature. Anthospermum holtzii is often found in moist, open woodlands and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
